an5.221:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks for someone who likes long and aimless wandering.
an5.221:4.3: You don’t learn new things. You don’t clarify what you’ve learned. You lack confidence in some things you have learned. You contract a severe illness. You don’t have any friends.
an5.221:4.4: These are the five drawbacks for someone who likes long and aimless wandering.
an5.221:5.1: There are these five benefits of a reasonable amount of wandering.
an5.221:5.3: You learn new things. You clarify what you’ve learned. You have confidence in some things you have learned. You don’t contract severe illness. You have friends.
an5.221:5.4: These are five benefits of a reasonable amount of wandering.”
